text: Jack Brierley (1911-1984) was an Australian rugby league footballer who played in the 1930s. A local junior from the Bexley junior rugby league football club, Brierley was graded in 1929 an went of to play a further six seasons with the St. George club before retiring in the lower grades in 1937.THE ST.GEORGE CALL (Kogarah) 31/7/1931 "Jack Brierley' Reference: https://trove.nla.gov.au/newspaper/article/232200225?searchTerm=%22jack%20brierley%22&searchLimits;=l-state=New+South+Wales|||l-decade=193 He is remembered as a slight, but tenacious Lock Forward. He later enjoyed a long association with the Bexley Golf Club. Whiticker/Hudson "The Encyclopedia Of Rugby League Players. 1995 Edition () Brierley died on 26 August 1984, 26 days short of his 73rd birthday.
